dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Boris Johnson, huh? Fresh off that, uh, October 31st "victory" with the referendum. What a ride!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Boris Johnson, huh? Fresh off that, uh, October thirty first victory with the referendum. What a ride!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Johnson has repeatedly said that he wanted the U.K. to leave the EU on October 31 do or die, but that certainly will not happen now.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, he immediately declared this bold new plan, right? Said the EU leaders, surprisingly, had agreed to an *immediate* Brexit departure. Bypassing that three-month delay everyone was talking about.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he immediately declared this bold new plan, right? Said the E U leaders, surprisingly, had agreed to an immediate Brexit departure. Bypassing that three-month delay everyone was talking about.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: EU leaders have agreed to grant the U.K. a three-month delay to Brexit, meaning the October 31 exit deadline has been extended until January 31, 2020, at the latest.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Which, um, was totally contradicted almost immediately by Donald Tusk!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, um, was totally contradicted almost immediately by Donald Tusk!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: EU Council president Donald Tusk tweeted the confirmation on Monday. He said: The EU27 has agreed that it will accept the U.K.s request for a Brexit flextension until 31 January 2020.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Exactly! Tusk, in a rare public statement, announced the EU27 had rejected that. Sticking to January 31st, 2020. No ifs, ands, or buts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! Tusk, in a rare public statement, announced the E U twenty seven had rejected that. Sticking to January thirty first, twenty twenty. No ifs, ands, or buts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The EU27 has agreed that it will accept the U.K.s request for a Brexit flextension until 31 January 2020.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So that "flextension" thing actually meant they *couldn't* leave before January 31st, even if both parliaments agreed on a deal?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So that flextension thing actually meant they couldn't leave before January thirty first, even if both parliaments agreed on a deal?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The flextension means that the U.K. would be allowed to leave the EU before January 31, if the British and European Parliaments ratifiy a deal before then.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like, it wasn't a flexible exit. It was a fixed date. You're staying 'til then.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like, it wasn't a flexible exit. It was a fixed date. You're staying til then.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The flextension means that the U.K. would be allowed to leave the EU before January 31, if the British and European Parliaments ratifiy a deal before then.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But hereâ€™s the kicker for me: Johnson, having just secured parliamentary approval for his deal...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But here's the kicker for me: Johnson, having just secured parliamentary approval for his deal...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Last week, lawmakers approved Johnsons deal in principle, by voting to approve Johnsons Withdrawal Agreement Bill, which sets out the terms of the U.K.s exit from the EU. Johnson then paused the deal after lawmakers rejected a short three-day window in which to debate it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, the Withdrawal Agreement Bill passed.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, the Withdrawal Agreement Bill passed.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Last week, lawmakers approved Johnsons deal in principle... Johnson then paused the deal after lawmakers rejected a short three-day window in which to debate it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: ...suddenly announces he'd seek an election on December 12th, hoping to, what, *overturn* the deal he just got approved?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...suddenly announces he'd seek an election on December twelfth, hoping to, what, overturn the deal he just got approved?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But for the bill to progress further, Johnson said on Friday that he would allow lawmakers to debate it if they agreed to allowing an election on December 12.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I know! It's wild. He's celebrating this "revised framework" after promising "do or die" by October 31st. And now he wants an election to essentially undo it all.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know! It's wild. He's celebrating this revised framework after promising do or die by October thirty first. And now he wants an election to essentially undo it all.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Johnson has repeatedly said that he wanted the U.K. to leave the EU on October 31 do or die, but that certainly will not happen now.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's such an about-face. He gets the deal through, like, 31 votes in the UK Parliament, and then...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's such an about-face. He gets the deal through, like, thirty one votes in the U K Parliament, and then...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: He fast-tracks it, gets frustrated by the pace, and then immediately pivots to a campaign rally, declaring the whole thing a "complete failure" and calling for December 12th.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He fast-tracks it, gets frustrated by the pace, and then immediately pivots to a campaign rally, declaring the whole thing a complete failure and calling for December twelfth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Johnson then paused the deal after lawmakers rejected a short three-day window in which to debate it. But for the bill to progress further, Johnson said on Friday that he would allow lawmakers to debate it if they agreed to allowing an election on December 12.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, he got his deal, then immediately decided it wasn't the deal he wanted after all?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, he got his deal, then immediately decided it wasn't the deal he wanted after all?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. It's, uh, quite the political maneuver, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. It's, uh, quite the political maneuver, isn't it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely bewildering. Never a dull moment, I guess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely bewildering. Never a dull moment, I guess.
